result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah J Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Criminal Case Settlement

Caae called at 9:50 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jeremiah J Morris in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck submits victim impact statement & amended information; Service of AMENDED information admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #2 of amended information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Sentencing arguments by ADA Beck; Statements by Rachel Nichols; Sentencing arguments by Atty Zarwell

On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 90 days jail, without Huber, consecutive to any other previously imposed sentence
On Count #2, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 90 days jail, without Huber, consecutive to Count #1
and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--To comply with conditions of injuntion in Jefferson County Case 13CV559
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--Engage in Anger Management as directed by Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No possession of any dangerous weapon as defined by statute
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count) 
--To pay $86 subpoena fees

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 10:18 am

Case called at 1:30 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Jeremiah J Morris in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell: Have been many conversations re: notice of alibi - understand that State was awaiting further information from investigator. Understand that the State is requesting an adjournment of trial. Have not prepared amended information as not resolving today.
ADA Teuber: Is accurate. Have been 3 new developments in case - Ct#2 is charged improperly-anticipate filing amended information. Ongoing investigation in reports received from Atty Zarwell, is new officer assigned to follow-up requests due to original officer's promotion. Did receive email from Det. Caucutt today indicating that he is working on follow-up. Parties have continued to regularly discuss resolution. Requests a couple weeks adjournment. 
Counsel agree 2 days is needed for trial
ADA Teuber: confirms victim rights compliance
Recess: 1:39 pm

Case called at 10:46 am 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jeremiah J Morris in court. DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges/maximum penalties recited
Mr. Morris informs the Court that he will be contacting the public defender's office

Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No acts/threats of violence
-No contact with Rachel Nichols, CSM (dob: 7/28/03) or SEM (dob: 10/12/07)
-No presence at any residence or location occupied by Ms. Nichols or CSM
-No presence at CSMs school
-Booking at JCSD
